meanings.definition: A small, almond-shaped mass of gray matter located in the brain.
meanings.sent1: The amygdale helps us feel emotions like happiness and fear.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study the amygdale to understand how our brain processes emotions.
meanings.sent3: When the amygdale is overactive, it can make us feel anxious for no reason.
meanings.sent4: Her amygdale seemed to shrink in moments of great stress, affecting her ability to think clearly.
meanings.sent5: The amygdale, like a tiny emotional switch in our brain, can quickly change our mood.

meanings.definition: A rounded mass of gray matter in the brain that is part of the limbic system and is involved in emotional responses.
meanings.sent1: The amygdale plays a crucial role in how we react to different situations.
meanings.sent2: Researchers have found a connection between the amygdale and our emotional memories.
meanings.sent3: Sometimes, it feels like my amygdale has a mind of its own, making me react in unexpected ways.
meanings.sent4: Her amygdale lit up like a firework display when she saw her favorite band perform live.
meanings.sent5: The amygdale, a key player in our emotional orchestra, influences our daily decisions.
